metadata.title: CVE-2023-6859 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free condition affected TLS socket creation when under memorypressure. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 115.6, Thunderbird <115.6, and Firefox < 121.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.6.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
